results.title: Barbie in the nutcracker
results.creator_credit: Mattel, Mainframe Entertainment, Jesyca C Durchin, Jennifer Twiner McCarron and Owen Hurley
results.brief_description: Superb computer animation brings Barbie to life in this modernized adaptation of E.T.A. Hoffmann’s classic story, ‘The Nutcracker’. Story heroine Clara receives a wooden Nutcracker as a gift from an aunt. As she sleeps the Nutcracker comes to life to save her from the evil Mouse King, who has invaded Clara’s house, unfortunately. Clara wakes and is shrunk by the Mouse King. The only person who can break the Mouse King’s spell and restore Clara to her original size is the Sugarplum Fairy, so Clara and the Nutcracker set off to find her. In her first full length movie, Barbie assumes the roles of Clara and the Sugarplum Fairy. Choreographed by Peter Martins and performed for animation by the New York City Ballet. Tchaikovsky’s musical score is performed by the London Symphony Orchestra. Features voices from Kelly Sheridan (Barbie/Clara), Kirby Morrow (Nutcracker/Prince Eric),Tim Curry (Mouse King), Peter Kelamis (Pimm), Christopher Gaze (Major Mint), Ian James Corlett (Captain Candy), French Tickner (Grandfather Drosselmayer) and Kathleen Barr (Aunt Drosselmayer).

results.title: Barbarella [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Marianne Productions, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Dino De Laurentiis and Roger Vadim
results.brief_description: This cult film by New Wave director Roger Vadim begins with a flawlessly executed zero gravity strip-tease by the film’s feisty 41st century space adventurer, Barbarella (Jane Fonda). The adventure begins when the president of Earth contacts Barbarella for her help in locating Durand Durand (Milo O’Shea), a young scientist who has vanished with a deadly positronic ray that contains the power to “shatter the loving union of the universe”. Her mission takes an unexpected twist after her fur-lined vessel makes a forced landing on the icy planet Lythion after being rocked by a magnetic disturbance. Barbarella soon faces a number of challenging situations that result in many costume changes, and pleasurable encounters with the handsome men who assist her as she continues to track the elusive Durand Durand. With the help of the angel, Pygar (John Phillip Law), Barbarella must infiltrate the city of SoGo and battle the Black Guards and the Great Tyrant - a sadistic seductress who wants Barbarella for her own devious purposes - to recover the devastating weapon and restore peace and order to the galaxy. Based on the French science-fiction comic by Jean-Claude Forest, with dazzling and inventive costume design by Jacques Fonteray and Paco Rabanne.

results.title: Baraka [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Magidson Films, Mark Magidson and Ron Fricke
results.brief_description: Shot in 24 countries, “Baraka” is an extraordinary visual feast that examines the passionate and destructive love/hate relationship between humans and earth. A spectacular diversity of memorable images have been gathered from around the world from the natural and man-made environments, both past and present. The style is strongly reminiscent of the film “Koyaanisqatsi” in its use of timelapse photography juxtaposed with slower sequences, and the somewhat sentimental, simplistic portrayal of humanity.

results.title: Bandit Queen
results.creator_credit: Film Four International, Kaleidoscope, Sundeep S Bedi and Shekhar Kapur
results.brief_description: This movie tells the “true story” of Phoolan Devi, the Indian bandit queen who was arrested in the state of Uttar Pradesh in 1983 for kidnapping and murder and was freed in 1994 because of a change in government. As a young girl she questioned the caste restrictions around her, is married at 13 but leaves the village and her marriage in search of independence. As a young woman she is captivated by Vikram, a bandit gang member. His gang kidnaps and rapes her, Vikram kills the leader and assumes leadership with Devi. Vikram is eventually killed in a dispute over leadership after SriRam returns from prison. Initially Devi is driven by seeking vengeance over the death of her lover, but after being gang raped by SriRam in her own village she is seeking revenge for herself. This culminates in the Behmai Massacre of February 1981. Cast includes Seema Biswas, Nirmal Pandey and Govind Namdeo.

results.title: Ball of fire
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn Company, Samuel Goldwyn and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: Gary Cooper takes centre stage in “Ball of fire” together with Barbara Stanwyck in Howard Hawks’ deliciously funny, and delightful romantic comedy. Cooper is a serious English professor working with his intellectual collegues on a dictionary of American slang. Stanwyck, a red-hot nightclub singer, on the run from the mob, seeks refuge in their house and finds a place in their hearts. Soon, the professor and his friends learn a lot about language and life, and Cooper and Stanwyck prove that the world of semantics is big enough for two who can speak the language of love.

results.title: Bagdad Cafe = Out of Rosenheim
results.creator_credit: Pelemele, Pro-Ject, Bayerischer Rundfunk, Hessischer Rundfunk, Percy Adlon and Eleonore Adlon
results.brief_description: Jasmin, a middle aged woman from Bavaria rows with her husband while on holiday in the US. She leaves him and finds herself alone in the desert off route 66, somewhere between Disneyland and Las Vegas. After wandering into a shabby motel complex, “Bagdad Cafe”- a watering hole run by bossy Brenda and frequented by a bizarre collection of individuals- an unlikely friendship develops between the two women. Stars Marianne Sagerbrecht, CCH Pounder and Jack Palance.

results.title: Badlands
results.creator_credit: Pressman Williams Badlands and Terrence Malick
results.brief_description: A young couple escape into the badlands of the Mid-West after the boy has dispassionately killed the girl’s unsympathetic father. The screenplay is based on fact, namely the exploits of Chris Starkweather and Caril Filgate in 1958. The film’s originality however arises from the counterpoint between the doomed romanticism courted by Kit and the detached narration by Holly. The story is a provocative study of people numbingly alienated from everyday life. Cast includes Martin Sheen, Sissy Spacek, Raymond Biere and Warren Oates.

results.title: Bad timing
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Recorded Picture Company, Jeremy Thomas and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: In Vienna a young woman (Theresa Russell), begins an affair with an American psychoanalyst (Art Garfunkel). The couple become sexually obsessed with one another, but his lack of trust, and his constant suspicions, lead her to alcohol, drugs and excess until one night she decides to take her own life. Or does he make the decision for her? A combination of thriller, detective story, and a study of alienation, “Bad Timing” both fascinates and disturbs. Technically the editing and production values of the film are superb. Also stars Denholm Elliott and Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Bad lieutenant (D)
results.creator_credit: Bad Lt Productions, Mary Kane, Edward Pressman and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: The film that put director Abel Ferrara on the film map, “Bad lieutenant” deconstructs the path from debauchery to redemption for a corrupt New York cop. Harvey Keitel stars as the out of control police lieutenant, turning in a mesmerizing performance that can only be described as feral. Co-written by Ferrara with Zoe Lund (who starred in Ferrara’s 1981 perverse revenge film “Ms. 45” and who also makes a brief appearance in “Bad lieutenant”), the film explores familiar terrain for the director, mainly debasement and redemption. Ferrara, not one to shy away from the darker aspects of human nature, follows his law enforcing protagonist as he gambles, steals, takes drugs and in one of the most uncomfortable scenes, sexually coerces two teenage girls. When a young nun is brutally raped on the alter of a local church, the ‘bad’ Lieutenant is called into the investigation. The horrific circumstances of the crime forces the corrupt Lieutenant to examine his own life, sending him into a spiral of despair and ultimately a chance at personal salvation. Cast includes: Paul Calderone, Victor Argo, Frankie Thorn, Paul Hipp, Victoria Bastel, Robin Burrows.

results.title: Bad boy Bubby
results.creator_credit: Fandango, Bubby Pty Ltd (Adelaide), Domenico Procacci, Giorgio Draskovic and Rolf De Heer
results.brief_description: Bubby (Nicholas Hope in a knockout performance) has spent the first thirty-five years of his life locked in a filthy room by a mother who systematically emotionally and sexually abuses him. His first encounter with his father ends in a violent confrontation which results in Bubby breaking through to the outside world. Alone and frightened, a child in an adult man’s body, he begins his first tentative steps into humanity. This strange, absorbing and distressing film is a stunning investigation into the alienation lacerating urban contemporary Australia. Watching the world through Bubby’s eyes challenges the viewer to re-examine our conventional ideas of what is “normal” and what is “strange”. Family, sexual politics, work, art, and adulthood are questioned by Bubby’s progress through the modern world. Winner of four AFI awards and the Grand Jury Special Prize at the Venice Film Festival.
